website_summaries.verdict: Several Zumba instructors recommend this high-performance shoe.
pros: Accommodates wide feet and provides plenty of support
Designed with material to allow your feet to breath
Made for more than dancing, the pivot point allows for a whole range of movements
cons: May not perform the best on all surfaces

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Dance Aerobic Shoe
customer_reviews.text: I had worn Rykas back when I was doing Jazzercise, so I was familiar with them. I normally wear a 7.5 B and that is what I ordered. Perfect fit, plenty of room for toes and comfortable on heel. Using them for Zumba and dance aerobics and have plenty of support for the bouncing and jumping and yet very light and easy to move across the floor, even on carpet. Really like the pivot spot on the soles. Colors are terrific, bright and energetic! I had looked at and tried on other brands' dance aerobics shoes (Nike, Reebok, etc.) but they just didn't feel "right" on my feet. Happy with my choice and would do it again.
customer_reviews.author: Meline Knago

customer_reviews.title: Not What Expected
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my wife for her PlyoJam (cardio, dance) class at the gym. They arrived the first week in July and worked well through mid-September. That's about 8 weeks of good wearing; she wore them once a week for one hour each week. By mid-September they provided less support; by the end of the month the outer shoe support was pretty much gone. The description of the shoe made me believe we could expect more from the shoe. I don't know that she'll be able to wear them for other classes since her foot ached after the last class. We buy workout shoes frequently so I feel qualified to judge workout shoe products.
customer_reviews.author: Bert

customer_reviews.title: Good comfortable and stables shoes at affordable price!
customer_reviews.text: I loved these shoes. When I first wore them they felt a bit odd, but I think that’s because my last pair of shoes had worn out badly. When I did my HIIT workout with these I can honestly say they made a big difference! I suffer from plantar fasciitis sometimes and these shoes are so lightweight and stable and the support is so good that I forgot to take them off for a couple hours after I was done! Would definitely recommend these. The price is great too compared to other good shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Rini

customer_reviews.title: Love these!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for Zumba & they are perfect for my needs. The tread pattern works well for pivots while gripping firmly for side to side movement. The toe box is a little wide so it created a crease that took a few days to break in or get used to, but after a short time they are now the most comfortable sneakers I have ever owned! (I am not paid or compensated in any way for these comments. This is my honest opinion & experience, just so you know.)
customer_reviews.author: New England Girl

customer_reviews.title: Bottom looked like it was worn
customer_reviews.text: Received these shoes yesterday morning via Prime and opened them finding no paper between shoes, one of the shoes discolored and having some type of wet candy or food on onside toe area. Bottom looked like it was worn. Nasty!! Four photos attached!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I'm on the fence about these - 3 weeks later - Not happy
customer_reviews.text: My zumba instructor suggested Ryka. I tried the Delish model - all soft memory foam and no support. The Influence are better made but totally lacks any insole support. I took the insole out and found it to be paper thin! I took the insole out of another pair of very high quality running shoes and I am going to try those insole inside the Ryka. Pivot point is critical for dance/Zumba. Final decision to keep or return is unclear. 3 weeks later......my hips hurt as well as my knees. Never had this before. The shoes have no lateral support for side lunges. Back to searching for a new zumba shoe!
customer_reviews.author: Aussieagilitymom

customer_reviews.title: Not True Wide Width
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because I have plantar fasciitis, and needed a cushioned insole with a wide width. These shoes were awful. Pinched my toes, and caused my heel to ache. Ryka used to be a good brand, but it has gone down hill recently. This was the second pair I tried. I thought a size up would help, but it is the shoes design. Not a true wide width.
customer_reviews.author: A. Brooklynite

customer_reviews.title: Serious shoes for serious training.
customer_reviews.text: I work out 6 days a week. I needed an affordable trainer that would at least provide lateral support and some toe cushion for burpees. I bought the Ryka Influence Cross Training shoe because well...affordable Ryka. I’m here to tell you that I got WAY more than I expected. These shoes cup my heels perfectly, great cushion & traction for burpees and explosive moves AND they have a wide base for lateral moves and weight training. Don’t let the price fool you. These are serious shoes for serious training. Grab em at this price while you can!
customer_reviews.author: Chula M.

customer_reviews.title: They are so great for Zumba and for other gym activities
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair of Influence style. They are so great for Zumba and for other gym activities. It has the pivot circle on the sole but is a little bit wider across the ball of foot, unlike the Grafik style ( which I also own) . I like the stability of the wider sole at the ball of foot so you cannot roll your foot by accident. The foot bed is only slightly padded. The tongue is padded, unlike the Deliberate, Love these shoes for fit and style.
customer_reviews.author: JT

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed with purchase
customer_reviews.text: I’m really disappointed with the Ryka shoe. I wanted a light weight and yet supportive cross training shoe and the product descriptions and review made me feel like this might be the shoe for me . The fit was fine, but weirdly my ankles and heel hurt a lot with this shoe. During my boot camp classes and long distance walks and or runs my calves and feet felt sore, I was unable to do many of my usual workouts. I am dissatisfied with my purchase . Unfortunately I cannot return the shoe because I wore it quite a few times hoping to break into it. Didnot work....
customer_reviews.author: Paul Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Great Cross Trainer For Gym Classes
customer_reviews.text: I bought these shoes to wear for classes at the gym. I had been using my old Saucony runners, which are adorable and I love them, but they just don't have enough arch support for me, after a couple years' struggle with Plantar Fasciitis. I have worn them for Kettlebells, Zumba, Cycling, Treadmill (mostly walking and jogging), Weight Training, and Elliptical. They are very comfortable, with no break in period. They fit perfectly, and provide good support for my PF. Before the gym closed down due to COVID-19, I'd say I wore them around the gym and at classes at least a dozen times. They show no signs of wear and remain comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: clpolaszek

customer_reviews.title: Zerocushion or support
customer_reviews.text: I have used cross training shoes for over 40 years and these have to be the worse. I'm not sure how these could be used for any fitness endeavor since there is absolutely NO padding /cushion of any kind. It is no better than walking in flip flops.
customer_reviews.author: swilliamson

customer_reviews.title: Shoes are made well, but they don't live up to the crazy hype.
customer_reviews.text: Shoes are made well, but don't live up to the crazy hype. They are comfortable to wear around but nothing special for cardio class. Not much support or bounce. "Pivot point" is no different than any other regular shoe. I returned these after having aching ankles and a tender lower back. Hoped to find something special, but going back to Skechers or Reebok zigtech. These may be great for other women, but for me they were not worth it. Thanks anyway Ryka.
customer_reviews.author: Sterf C.

customer_reviews.title: My favorite shoe
customer_reviews.text: This is the second pair I have purchased and it feels a true half size smaller than my first pair. I use them for cycling and walking. I can only wear this pair for short trips to the store because when walking or biking my toes rub too much on the right foot. My first pair are absolutely perfect. Had this happen while trying on I would have immediately exchanged for a 6.5. My sisters seen these shoes and had me order each of them a pair for themselves. Both of their shoes are fine, I guess I got the defective pair.
customer_reviews.author: Doreen

customer_reviews.title: No Front Support
customer_reviews.text: I saw where these shoes were recommended for Zumba and cross training so I bought them for that purpose. There's no support at all in the front. I'm not sure how anyone could do a workout in these and still have their knees intact.
customer_reviews.author: Fishy!

customer_reviews.title: Toe box too cramped. Not rounded like most.
customer_reviews.text: Most of the Rykka shows I have purchased, I love, and I have several pair. I purchased these because my black pair that I own is the only pair that has an angled to box that squeezes my toes, rather than the nice round toe box that all my others have. Unfortunately, this black pair has a similar toe box to the model I already have, so as beautiful as they are, I had to return them. :-) Other than the squished toe box, they seemed true to size.
customer_reviews.author: Jill Brooks

customer_reviews.title: I love them! They are light-weight and the pivot point ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these shoes after I had been in a Zumba class for about 2 months. My walking sneakers were just too heavy and clunky. I compared them to doing Zumba with snow tires on my feet. After doing some very quick Google searches for "Best Zumba Shoes", I had a list of 4 or 5 to check out. These were closest to my budget. I love them! They are light-weight and the pivot point makes Zumba much easier. I have been wearing them for Zumba for over a year. I don't wear them for anything else. They provide good support.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara P.

customer_reviews.title: Does not bend in the right places
customer_reviews.text: This shoes is extremely light weight. It felt more like a dance shoe than a cross trainer when I put it on. I was initially optimistic to try this brand, but my optimism was betrayed on step 2. The sole of a shoe is supposed to "break" at your metatarsal heads, i.e. just behind the toes. Unfortunately this shoe "breaks" right in the dang middle. This means there is A) no structure to support the longitudinal arch of the foot, and B) the fabric of the top of the shoe creases awkwardly in and immediately started rubbing my toes.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah S.

customer_reviews.title: Not for a narrow foot and not comfortable after a few hours
customer_reviews.text: I have a narrow foot and its really hard to find shoes that fit. I do not like these shoes because it does not have that extra "eye hole" that helps tighten the shoe. So in order to keep my foot from slipping around in the shoe I have to excessively tighten the laces. I can only wear the shoes for a few hours before my feet feel fatigued in them. I will be going back to Asics.
customer_reviews.author: Letra

customer_reviews.title: The worst Ryka shoe EVER!
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are horrible! I walked around my home on carpet and did not experience discomfort. However, when I actually wore the shoes to my Zumba class it was a horrendous experience! I had to leave class after 15 minutes. The shoes rubbed my bones raw in certain spots, the arch was not aligned correctly, there is very little padding so I could never wear these shoes as just regular walking around shoes, I could barely do pivots in my zumba class. These shoes are utter trash!!
customer_reviews.author: Happycampernot

customer_reviews.title: The description on the shoes functionality is a lie. Should not be categorized as the number 1 recommended Zumba shoes
customer_reviews.text: The description on the shoes functionality is a lie. This should not be categorized as the number 1 recommended Zumba shoes because it does not deliver as advertised. It's hard to make turns, it does npt slide well enough for Zumba. On my 1st use it immediately gave me pains on my knees while doing zumba moves. I tried it 3rd time in another gym doing zumba. I could say at this point that definitely not recommendable for zumba! I wish I can return the shoes. I have not used it since then
customer_reviews.author: Carina Villena

customer_reviews.title: Weird Fit
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to be travel sneakers to hit the gym while on the road because my daily running fitness sneaker are thick. These are made for thin rectangular feet. They were tight and long. Like a size too big while narrow in weird places. After a 2 mile walk, I decided not for me and gifted them to charity. I have liked Ryka's in the past. These felt cheap and supportless. Sorry not a fan at all and would not recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: P. Brannigan

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for kickboxing
customer_reviews.text: I’d seriously give them 10 stars if I could. I kickbox and have knee pain. My kneecaps shift out of place sometimes. These shoes are amazing and have kept me from being in pain since I got them. I didn’t realize how much the narrower heel area was going to make a difference but it’s night and day. I bought a 9w and they are true to size.
customer_reviews.author: KELLY A. MCGILL

customer_reviews.title: Saved my knees! Great for impact
customer_reviews.text: I have had these for a month now and decided it was time to finally review the shoes that completely changed my game! I was previously wearing an inexpensive pair of running shoes for HIIT workouts at home that had no support, especially laterally. My knees were really bothering me so I decided to try this pair of cross trainers. What an absolute WORLD of difference! They have support in places I never knew shoes could. The lateral and arch support is incredible. My knee pain has vanished, jumping and high impact exercises are easier, and I have more stamina in my workouts. Highly recommend these for impact exercise and high intensity training.
customer_reviews.author: Vee

customer_reviews.title: Very good exercise shoe for low impact aerobics and lateral movements.
customer_reviews.text: Very good exercise shoe for low impact aerobics and lateral movements. Fits firmly along the side of the foot providing good lateral support. May not be suitable for those who perform high impact aerobics if they need good cushioning for the ball and heel areas of the foot.
customer_reviews.author: An Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice shoe - narrow toe
customer_reviews.text: Really like the older styles of Ryka, and this shoe is nice, but not the same fit as the Grafic 2. The toe is slightly narrower making it a different fit. I normally wear a size 10 or 10 1/2 depending on style, so got a 10 1/2 with the first pair based on 'fit' as rated. That being a little large, I ordered a 10, but now a little too narrow in the toe so had to return. Can only suggest if you are an in-between or need toe room I would suggest go up a half size.
customer_reviews.author: dusty@so cal

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes for Zumba!
customer_reviews.text: I needed a good pair of shoes for my Zumba class and read great reviews about this product. I wear a 7 1/2 and they seem to fit pretty well. I still need to add some insoles to make it a little softer or I can double up on my socks. I have to say they did make my feet stop hurting during my Zumba class. I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonLover

customer_reviews.title: Fit not consistent with other Ryka shoe
customer_reviews.text: I love the color and design of the Ryka Influence shoe. I already have a Ryka Devotion shoe, 8.5 Wide, which is very comfortable with lots of arch support and plenty of space for my wide foot, but is too narrow in the heel. This shoe, the Devotion, also 8.5 Wide, fits my heel nicely, but does not have much arch support or equivalent width as Devotion. I'm considering returning it.
customer_reviews.author: J.

customer_reviews.title: I really like this shoe
customer_reviews.text: My regular shoe size is 8.0-8.5, so I usually round up for athletic shoes. I bought the 8.5, and they are a little larger than expected. Size 8.0 might have been a better fit, but I can use these. I love the look: They are more lightweight than previous shoes I have worn (a feature that I like). My workout includes the treadmill (walking, no running) and some strength training, and these provide adequate support. I've worn Ryka in the past, and I had forgotten how much I appreciate that the shoe is made for women--not simply a smaller version of men's shoes. Highly recommend Ryka.
customer_reviews.author: Murrill

customer_reviews.title: Different colors fit differently
customer_reviews.text: I order the wider shoe based on having purchased the regular width and returned. I’ve never worn wide width before, but the regular width were so tight. The wider shoes just felt....weird. It should be noted they were a different color than the original ordered ones. One was the right fit, the other felt like a totally different shoe. The sole support was different, toe box was wider, leaned to one side, and a few other inconsistencies between the left and right shoes. Returned them. I just decided that I don’t care to try another pair. Disappointed because the regular width felt great for support, but were just too tight.
customer_reviews.author: Chels0219

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable in spite of being lightweight
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are great for zumba, dance, tabata, and strength training. They are really lightweight and at first I didn't think they would provide enough support or comfort but I have to say, I have been using them for close to a year now 2-3 times a week for various exercise and they are great! They feel fairly roomy in the toe box, I have a high arch and these seem to be just fine for that (the tongue is NOT sewn in so adjustable across the vamp), flexible for dance but supportive and surprisingly comfortable. Will buy again when wear these out.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Finally found a good shoe for dance cardio!
customer_reviews.text: I did some online searches for shoes that would be good for dance cardio, and Ryka kept showing up. I was a little skeptical since I’ve not really heard of this brand much. I am very pleased! They fit nicely and the sole tread is designed for a range of foot movement. I didn’t know that really mattered until now. I didn’t realize how much the tread style on my shoes were making it difficult to twist and turn my feet during the choreography. These shoes have made all the difference!
customer_reviews.author: Nmpollard

customer_reviews.title: Good shoe for Indoor workouts/cardio (not used for running)
customer_reviews.text: It is fine. I don’t have experience with HIIT shoes or specific for indoor workouts but they seem to be good. I’m Usually a solid 10 in women’s and these seem a tad big all around, but I can easily tighten the laces and the toe... could be half inch smaller. Overall my feet don’t slide even with those noted differences in this size 10. They look a little big on me but I HAVE a size 10 haha ... like I said just a tad big overall. Not sure if they have half sizes so 9 could have been too small. Not gonna try a 9 because I’d rather room. I have separate running shoes FYI
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Definitely worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: I love these sneakers. I am an avid walker, I typically walk 2-5 miles daily. I don't like to spend alot on sneakers because I wear the tread right off in a few months. I decided to splurge on these because I was having trouble with arch pain in my feet along with hip, back and knee pain, especially post walk. I have not had those issues since using these shoes! Also, they seem to have great tread so that you have great footing when w as lking running at a high pace, on hills. This is important because I walj my 2 large dogs and I need to have solid footing if they start pulling. Definitely worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Marie Pelletier

customer_reviews.title: Love these shoes
customer_reviews.text: I've been searching for new sneakers and was between this and an ASICS. I'm very glad I chose Ryka. I just got them today. I ordered a half size up as is recommended and I couldn't believe how its a perfect fit. I love the foot cushion inside it supports my foot exactly how I want it to; the inside of my foot is where the cushion is. I have a mild suppination this catches it perfectly. I'm excited to go break these in. Oh and I even love the colors the cream orange and the vibrant purple stripes make this shoe look so cool.
customer_reviews.author: Alpha92

customer_reviews.title: Ryka, not for me!
customer_reviews.text: Ryka dance sneakers may have a good rating but.... The sizing and fit are weird for me. Thanks to the generosity of Amazon I was able to try different sizes of the same model, never fit! I am a retired Zumba Instructor and know a shoe has to fit all over.
customer_reviews.author: bhz

customer_reviews.title: Very Little Padding
customer_reviews.text: I got these because they're recommended highly for zumba and, indeed, the sole of the shoe makes it easy to pivot. I wore them only to, from and in the gym. But for jumping, classes and biking, these didn't work for me. My ankles sprain easily and without support both had small sprains and a once familiar pain in my left foot sprang back to life. I'm giving them away. They may be fine for folks who don't need more padding and more support. For me, these were a disaster.
customer_reviews.author: pier g. foreman

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe!
customer_reviews.text: This is my first time wearing Ryka shoes. I bought these cross trainers for Jazzercise classes after many people in the class suggested this brand. They have good traction, good arch support and they are light weight without feeling cheap. I will place a ball pad in them though as I like a bit more padding. I have had foot problems in the past so happy that they have the arch support that I need. I only wear them in the dance studio so I am hoping that they will last awhile.
customer_reviews.author: Dhop

customer_reviews.title: high arch/narrow heel - these were painful (usually wear ryka Grafik2)
customer_reviews.text: I decided to try this style after my Ryka Grafik2 shoes wore out. I use these for Zumba/Ujam. For some reason, the Influence was painful to the soles of my feet and made my toes fall asleep. I tried adding stiffer insoles, but still had a lot of discomfort. I noticed that the Influence has a ton of padding on the back of the shoe above the heel. I wonder if that contributed to the strange fit? I have a high arch and narrow heel. I'm grateful I can exchange them through amazon, but wanted to caution other people who like the Grafik2... this shoe may not be for you.
customer_reviews.author: Kib Kib

customer_reviews.title: Not for me
customer_reviews.text: The shoe is comfortable and the sole is supportive but the sides give way too much. They may be fine for walking, weight room etc but definitely not for Zumba. They just have no side support in the mesh fabric. My feet hurt after my class. Not a good sign. I'll keep them for walking but continue to search for a good solid supporting shoe for Zumba.
customer_reviews.author: Annie MacMurray

customer_reviews.title: Pointier toe box, not rounded.
customer_reviews.text: I have owned 5 pairs of Riyadh shoes- usually love them! But this shoe is a different shape. Instead of the generous rounded toe, it has a more pointed toe shape which now hits my little toes. Even just a short walk around the room & I could tell they were going to cause trouble there. I have to send them back, even though I love the way they look. They also do not seem nearly as cushy as my other Rykas.
customer_reviews.author: D. Hayes

customer_reviews.title: Run small
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable shoe for Zumba and step class-good ability to pivot and nice side to side stability. Light and comfortable-easier on my knees with quick turns. I like my Asics better for standing balance, running and elliptical type workouts. I usually wear 9.5 in athletic shoes and had to size up to a 10. My feet are normal width and they feel nice and snug but not too narrow. Once I had the correct size they were great.
customer_reviews.author: BobnAnn

customer_reviews.title: Good fit and support/order size up
customer_reviews.text: I've only had them for a week but so far so good. I wear them everyday to Jazzercise and I'm still breaking them in. Seem comfortable and supportive so far. Ryka's in general definitely run small, at least in my experience, so I knew to order up. My normal shoe size is an 8.5-9 and I actually ordered a 9.5 in these and they are the right size for me, but I don't want my sneakers tight when I work out. Color is lighter grey than I had expected. Online Picture made them look like a dark charcoal grey - almost black. These are a light-medium grey but that didn't really bother me.
customer_reviews.author: Trish920

customer_reviews.title: Roomy Toe Box can Bend in on Toes (ow)
customer_reviews.text: While made for dancing, the toe box is too wide and roomy and when I bent my toes (even while walking) the shoe folded into my foot painfully. I recommend you try on the shoes in a local store before buying them online, as everyone has different issues with sizing when it comes to their feet. I ended up buying a pair shoes I had bought before, knowing that they fit already, and simply replacing them.
customer_reviews.author: Savvy customer

customer_reviews.title: Just ordered a second pair!
customer_reviews.text: These are by far the most comfortable sneakers I’ve ever owned! I have spent much more money on brands like nike, adidas, and new balance that don’t even come close to the comfort I get in these for a fraction of the price. I had done some research on the best sneakers for high impact activities since my feet were left throbbing both during and after exercise in my nikes. These came up as a top recommendation. So glad they did!
customer_reviews.author: Michele

customer_reviews.title: Very light, but not much arch support
customer_reviews.text: Bought these because they were rated as the #1 shoes online for Zumba classes. I wanted to love these shoes, but I am not very impressed after the first few times wearing these in Zumba classes. My feet hurt in the middle of Zumba classes. I like that they are very light. They are comfortable just for walking, but not for intense Zumba classes. They did not have much arch support.
customer_reviews.author: MStacy33

customer_reviews.title: Wide is not Wide
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to find a shoe made for women - and based on many magazines ranking these in the top cross-training shoe for women. I ordered a 9 Wide, based on normally wearing an 8 1/2 wide and the reviews suggested a half size up. This is the shortest size 9 shoe ever. My toes are crammed in the front - and the wide is a very tight fit. Too tight. I am returning this, will go back to New Balance for my cross-training shoe.
customer_reviews.author: babs1234

customer_reviews.title: Good HIIT shoe for the money and much better than your typical running shoe
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe for HIIT workout. Much better than the popular formfitting mesh/nylon gym shoe because it has a wider sole and more structure for top of foot. Only complaint is that my foot does slide a bit inside the shoe, I wish the insole had a little more grab. All in all, a good choice for the money and the right tool for the CrossFit/hiit job.
customer_reviews.author: Holly L.

customer_reviews.title: Not good for Zumba.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these shoes because they were highly recommended for Zumba. I was so disappointed because the shoes drag on the carpet and the pivot ball didn’t work for me. Also, there was not enough arch support. The fit was great. I ordered a 10, though I usually wear a 9.5. They are very nice shoes, but won’t work for my Zumba class.
customer_reviews.author: T. Goodwin

customer_reviews.title: Toe box is too big, shoe is super light
customer_reviews.text: I regularly do 2 different fitness classes, Zumba and Bodypump. I purchased these sneakers based on reviews for zumba-shoes, but I am going to continue using them only for bodypump. In my last zumba class, I almost ended the class barefoot because these shoes make my toes so uncomfortable and my feet feel unsupported. They are fine for body pump - mostly weights with squats and lunges. I was hoping for a shoe I could wear for both, unfortunately thought - this is not the pair.
customer_reviews.author: S. Sacks

customer_reviews.title: Great for Jazzercise and Zumba
customer_reviews.text: I picked up dance cardio again this year. I thought my new running shoes would be fine, but soon I found my ankles hurting. I found Ryka through an article on "best shoes for jazzercise" and sure enough they rock! They fit so nice and whatever it is that makes them different, I can dance around and my ankles don't hurt. I have a wide foot and the 10 W fit great; almost too roomy in the toe box but not so much that I'd exchange them. And maybe the room is for when we swivel or pivot. Anyway, they feel great on and make a difference. You do need a different shoe for dance cardio. And these are it!
customer_reviews.author: LA 6730

customer_reviews.title: light weight
customer_reviews.text: These Ryka shoes uphold the tradition of the fine fitting combi-last of a narrower heel and wider toe box that I expect with every purchase from Ryka. "Designed By Women For Women" was the company's motto when they first entered the market. Still applies, I hope.
customer_reviews.author: C. A. Wise

customer_reviews.title: I believe these are great shoes, just not for me
customer_reviews.text: I believe these are great shoes, just not for me. I got them because I do a lot of aerobics and walking and thought I needed something specifically for those activities. I walked around the house in these but found that my toes rubbed on the inside, and I do not have wide feet at all. I just think these were not the shoes for me, although I believe they are quality, well made shoes.
customer_reviews.author: L.Will

customer_reviews.title: You will love these shoes.
customer_reviews.text: This is my first purchase of RYKA Women's Shoes. I love these shoes! I put them on and they fit perfect. At the time I had a smashed little toe and was a bit apprehensive to put them on. I was happy they had some wiggle room at the front. I have just started weight training for both upper and lower body. Regular walking shoes had too much height in the heel. These have worked great. I am 65 and recovering from a difficult knee surgery. Balance is very important to me. I recommend them highly.
customer_reviews.author: Bebe

customer_reviews.title: Too much toe room.
customer_reviews.text: This is my 2nd pair of Ryka. Too much toe room here. I even tried a half size down in this one after my last pair of size 10 Ryka in a different style seemed too big. The 9.5 was way too small, and I normally can go between 9.5-10. I was looking for a good aerobics/step aerobics shoe. Both are simply too big in the toe box and the front of my foot slides around causing me to feel unstable and unsafe. They are great for weight training classes and hanging out. Super cute and basically comfy, but terrible for lateral and quick movement.
customer_reviews.author: Cody N. Eyman

customer_reviews.title: Order your regular shoe size—do not size up!
customer_reviews.text: I started HITT training and needed a cross trainer instead of wearing my running shoes. I normally wear a 5.5 to 6 women’s regular shoe, but normally wear a 6.5 in exercise shoes. I ordered. 6.5, too big, ordered a 6, STILL too big, and got the 5.5 and it’s just right. I do not recommend ordering up a half size if you normally do for exercise/running shoes. I have a narrow-regular width foot but I have a bunion on the right, and these shoes had a PERFECT toe box for someone with a bunion. Used them twice and there is good stability for side to side motion.
customer_reviews.author: Bearcat_VA

customer_reviews.title: Defective- remove insert to look for defects
customer_reviews.text: The are defective. They were very uncomfortable and hurt my foot so I I had to remove insert to put in my own orthotics and that’s when I saw the sneaker was defective as you can see in the pics. They are being returned and a new pair is being shipped out. I’ll let you know how it goes. These were highly recommended for zumba
customer_reviews.author: LA Moondog

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes
customer_reviews.text: It makes a huge difference to wear the right shoes for Zumba. My knees had begun to hurt because I was wearing my running shoes. At the recommendation of the instructor I bought these, and immediately my knee pain was gone during class. A friend of mine has had hers for 4 years doing Zumba 4 to 5 times a week and its still holding up. The shoes have tight fit. I could have gotten half a size bigger or the wide length. Now I just don't lace it too tight. And they look very cute!
customer_reviews.author: Mario Reifschneider

customer_reviews.title: Good for "light" stuff
customer_reviews.text: The shoe is very cute but it's really only for light stuff, like going to the grocery store or lifting weights in the gym. I tried it in my Strength Class and Cardio Dance class, but it's too light and the mesh is too "soft" so my foot is sliding around in it. Can't do any plyo, jumps, even with lunges my foot slides around. The size is the right size, it's just not enough support and mesh is too loose. I'll keep it as my "walk around" shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Amazing GRIP, and Comfortable Shoes! Great for Zumba and Pilates
customer_reviews.text: Pro's: These shoes do not slip. They are VERY comfortable, and I can do a whole Pilates class without taking them off, (as other's take their shoes off for pilates.) Comfortable enough to maneuver through Zumba without slipping. Very light and durable shoe. Con's: I wear between an 8 and 8 1/2. I got an 8 wide because my feet are wide. These came a little big, about 8 1/2 instead of 8, even though it says size 8. I still wear them because they are awesome shoes.
customer_reviews.author: C. Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Feels great, fits like a dream!
customer_reviews.text: I love these shoes! I bought them for the indoor walking workouts that I do in my living room and they are perfect! I feel like I can do any move Jessica Smith (of Jessicasmithtv, she's awesome!) throws at me now. There's plenty of support, the laces aren't too short like on my Nike's or too fat/hard to tie like on my New Balance's, and they just feel great! I like that they are designed by women for women. I didn't realize that at first but it was a major selling point. I may never buy another brand again!
customer_reviews.author: Katherine E. Shelby

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Zumba shoes
customer_reviews.text: Very good dance sneakers. This is my first time wearing Ryka after intensive research on best Zumba shoes online. It enables me to slide across the floor without the rubber soles sticking to the floor. I was able to quickly get used to its firm side supports. My only con is that this shoes' shoelace tie is too low or shallow (?) and I feel like it is going to fly off if I kick too forcefully. I had to tie the shoestring tighter than I usually do with my other sneakers. Good arch support and my feet, ankles and knees did not hurt at all.
customer_reviews.author: Loucks

customer_reviews.title: These are the best zumba shoes I have ever worn
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these shoes for my mom for her zumba classes. She messaged me right after class to ask if she could leave a review. Mom: These are the best zumba shoes I have ever worn! I usually get a sharp ache in my arch during class. No pain at all! I was able to perform spin moves effortlessly. No resistance. I didn't fatigue as quickly. Will be buying another pair soon!
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Britton

customer_reviews.title: Pivot point doesn’t spin, not for Zumba!
customer_reviews.text: They fit great and we’re comfortable, would be fine for simply walking shoes. However I bought them specifically for Zumba, specifically because of the pivot point that is supposed to allow you to spin without stressing your knees. Trust me, if that’s why you’re buying these, try Bloch dance sneakers instead! They’re the same price and they actually do spin, even if they’re a little ugly! On my wooden dance floor, these completely stuck and gave me any troubles the first time I tried them. Too bad, they were cute!
customer_reviews.author: S atkins

customer_reviews.title: Love Love Love!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I don’t know what it is about Ryka shoes but they fit me perfectly! I have a medium size 10 foot but have a pretty high arch. For some reason it’s very hard for me to find that trainers or any sneakers that are comfortable yet stylish. I’ve tried 200 dollar shoes and always come back to Ryka because of the fit. I needed a new pair of trainers and these aren’t just comfortable they look GREAT!!! And the price is great!!!! Thank You Ryka!!
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: no breaking in necessary!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these shoes to use at the gym and was very pleased when I first put them on. Rykas are made for women’s feet and I had no breaking in period which was amazing! These shoes keep my feet stable and offer great support plus I wear a size 10 which ran true to size. Would highly recommend these shoes for anyone looking for a good stable shoe for cross training or even just walking.
customer_reviews.author: D. Cartee

customer_reviews.title: Great Shoes for Everyday
customer_reviews.text: These Ryka cross trainers work equally well for walking and working out. They fit well -- I am a 9.5W with a AA heel and they fit comfortably across my instep (with socks) without leaving gaps at the heel. Colors are true to the images shown at Amazon - I purchased the black shoes with blue/green banding. I would recommend these shoes for anyone looking for a reasonably priced cross trainer.
customer_reviews.author: L. Rolston

customer_reviews.title: Fit well, but not trainers
customer_reviews.text: The fit is spot on but these don't feel like training shoes, maybe light walking, and it feels really cheap. I've bought a few pairs of shoes and the quality of these were in comparison to some of the $20-30 shoes I bought, same cheap foamy feeling that just feels like it'd give out maybe with a month of heavy use and not very sturdy. Seems like it'd be great depending on your workout style and they are kinda cute but just not worth the money when you can buy shoes of the same quality for half the price.
customer_reviews.author: Tory Thai

customer_reviews.title: Toe box narrower than usual
customer_reviews.text: Love the design, especially the reflective stripes. I got the Steel Grey/Chrome Silver and colors were exactly what I expected. I started buying Ryka sneakers for their roomier forefoot (toe box), but this sneaker is not as roomy as other Ryka sneakers. They are also slightly shorter than usual so that my toe is slightly touching the front. The insole was very comfortable and the riser in the back very cushioned. I would have loved to keep this sneaker. Since there is nothing wrong with the sneaker itself, I will still award 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: HausFrau

customer_reviews.title: Fit like a dream!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve never had running shoes that didn’t destroy my feet upon the first time wearing them until now! Usually running shoes either pinch my toes the arch is slightly off or they grind the back of my heels. These fit perfect the first time I put them on and they didn’t hurt my feet! Everything about these are great, I just wish they were a little more breathable. Your feet will definitely sweat in these!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I was searching for a sneaker with a more comfortable toe box. I’ve worn only one name brand sneaker for years-N brand. The last couple of pairs were tight on my toes. I was impressed by these reviews & that they are made for women. These are very comfortable yet sturdy. Toes are perfect. Arch is perfect. I’m very happy with these. I think I’ve found my new favorite brand.
customer_reviews.author: Carol

customer_reviews.title: Great Fit, Super Supportive
customer_reviews.text: I don't usually buy shoes online without trying them on in a store first, but I did that with these and I'm so happy with them. I ordered my usual size and the fit is perfect. They are very comfortable and offer great support, even for relatively high-impact sports. They don't have super nubby, grippy treads, so they're perfect for use on a carpet or bare floor if you like to do dance-type exercise at home.
customer_reviews.author: Emily Postal

customer_reviews.title: Happy camper
customer_reviews.text: I have a wide foot and ordered a size 10 wide. When I took them out of the box, I thought "oh no, these will not fit.". To my surprise they are a great fit, light weight and very comfortable from the first day. I love the grey color too. The tongue is not too high on my foot either. I am 70 years old and quite heavy. Try these! I think you will love them!
customer_reviews.author: Edna

customer_reviews.title: Nice shoe, but NOT for Zumba!
customer_reviews.text: Nice shoe but not enough support for Zumba. After wearing to my regular Zumba classes, my heels were sore. This has never happened before. Gave the shoe to chances. Same thing happened. Not enough support in heel to fully do Zumba.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie Doliner

customer_reviews.title: Order Larger Size...
customer_reviews.text: After trying many different athletic shoes, I finally received these and liked them the best. The style isn't weird like some these days, and it is flattering on the foot. I typically wear an 8.5 shoe - and get a size 9 in an athletic shoe. However, even at a 9 it's a bit snug and need to wear a thin sock with it. If you want to insert an orthotic - order 1 full size larger. Not a bad price, given what similar shoes sell for these days...but runs small all around.
customer_reviews.author: liberty

customer_reviews.title: Great for boxing and HIIT
customer_reviews.text: So far I'm loving these! I had crossfit shoes that cost a fortune and wore out quickly. I've been doing boxing with HIIT and these shoes have the pivot point for correct boxing stance and lateral movements. I was very nervous about buying shoes online because I have wide feet. I ordered the 9.5 and they fit great. A little extra room in the front but perfect width. I will definitely buy again when they wear out.
customer_reviews.author: Bada Binx

customer_reviews.title: Works great for Zumba!
customer_reviews.text: I have worn Ryka's for a few years. I wear the cross trainers. They don't work super for zumba, so I decided to get this new pair. It has a circle on the soul that makes it good for dancing and moving around. They are super light weight, very flexible and I love them! Pain in my joins has gone way down using these.
customer_reviews.author: languagelady

customer_reviews.title: Some pros some cons meant for weight lifting and pushups
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Cushioned heel is nice for squats Nice cushioning around edge of heel Lightweight Bendy for push-ups Perfect for no cardio/impact just weights Cons NO padding for mid sole or toe - very hard and doesn’t absorb impact I went running in these and it kills my knees every time due to lack of cushion Toe box is nice and wide but pinky toe area cuts off too early and rubs
customer_reviews.author: Firefighter

customer_reviews.title: Awesome shoes!
customer_reviews.text: My feet are wide and size 10.5. I was skeptical about ordering shoes online as I have trouble in stores. Ryka had a size chart you could print from their website. It made ordering the correct size a dream. I love that I could actually find a wide with 10.5 shoe in hot pink! Usually, I can have any color I want as long as it's black. The shoes have been terrific for Zumba. Love em!
customer_reviews.author: Crimsonkitten

customer_reviews.title: ryka influence
customer_reviews.text: horrible fit and feel even though they were the right size...very uncomfortable and stiff over forefoot and unable to walk normally
customer_reviews.author: jane federman, m.d.

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for me:(
customer_reviews.text: Most uncomfortable shoes I have ever bought! I purchased them for dance fitness classes upon recommendations by the instructor, but they do not fit well at all. The laces area is tight and the front is too big. I tried them with thin socks, thick socks, but nothing helped. I even tried loosening the laces but then they became too loose to dance. If I tightened the laces for a better grip, the ball of my feet started hurting or I started feeling tingling in my toes. I wish I could return them. It is a lot of money for bad fitting shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not bad
customer_reviews.text: These are nice shoes. I have a normal width foot. I usually wear an 8.5 or 9 so I purchased these shoes in a 9 and they fit well. I have plenty of room for the little bit of swelling I experience each day in my feet and a lot of room in the toe box. However, the arch support seems nonexistent. I have a normal arch and I don’t feel any arch support when I wear these. It hasn’t caused any pain or issues but it makes me wonder if I will eventually.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie York

customer_reviews.title: Great for Bunions!
customer_reviews.text: Ladies, if you have bunions look no further than these sneakers. Finally a comfortable fit! I ordered a 9 Wide because of my bunions and they fit great. I finally feel like my feet have room in these shoes. They also have great arch support. I'm not sure they would be the right fit for every kind of foot, but I love them! Thank You, Ryka!
customer_reviews.author: Colorado

customer_reviews.title: Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: Bought 8.5 wide had to get the 9 wide. Return and replacement time was quick. Getting the shoe was quick. These shoes had no wear in. I put them on and they were comfortable and work with all my workout styles. Lounges, side to side stuff and in and out ab workouts. Side note I have no arches! These get the job done. Probably won't last 6 months but worth the $50 I paid.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah J Rice

customer_reviews.title: Not for Zumba
customer_reviews.text: These are cute sneakers, however they are NOT good for Zumba. They have all kinds of grips on them. The pivot point is there but meaningless. Maybe I will try running in them but I just don't know.
customer_reviews.author: Gina De Shrage

customer_reviews.title: Fits small and tight
customer_reviews.text: I have narrow feet, but this shoe is very tight and fits a half size small. I purchased these shoes to workout and there’s no way I can wear them due to the size. They are moderately priced shoes so I am pretty upset they do not fit as expected. I may try to contact the seller since the return window passed and I never wore them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bought for Zumba and other aerobics but comfy enough to wear all day
customer_reviews.text: Huge upgrade in comfort from anything I could find at my local chain stores. Comfy, shoes I can wear all day without pinching or rubbing. I ordered different sizes to compare and opted for size 9W. I fluctuate from 8.5 to 9.5 depending on brands. Once I heal up from a gym injury I look forward to really working out in these shoes as I initially bought for Zumba and other high intensity exercise. Give them a try!
customer_reviews.author: TABZ

customer_reviews.title: Nice shoes for Dancing
customer_reviews.text: Its been almost one month since I am using these shoes. I had the arch problem while dancing with earlier shoes. But this one helped me a lot. It also gives you a little bounce which makes your moves easier. The only thing which I find a little problematic is they stick sometimes to the floor and it makes a little harder sometimes to move freely while dancing. Rest they are good shoes and I will definitely buy once again when needed.
customer_reviews.author: Annie

customer_reviews.title: Cat urine smell
customer_reviews.text: Shoe is nice fit and comfortable. After a few months the shoes developed a smell like cat pee. All efforts at cleaning and deodorizing have not worked. Have used Ryka for years so they must have changed materials to save money
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: They’re “okay”
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a fairly inexpensive mat shoe that I could do lateral side to side movements in. Many shoes have a thin material around the toe and wears out quickly - this shoes has the stronger material there I was looking for. They work find for what I needed - however they are not “comfortable” by any means. It very much padding.
customer_reviews.author: AD

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Zumba Sneakers-Holy Cow!
customer_reviews.text: Never before have I worn a pair of shoes right out of the box, first try and been so happy. All the room across the top of my foot allowed me to wear a size 9. Usually I buy a size 9 1/2 to give me more space up top, but didn't need to. Using these for Zumba Strong, not a blister or raw spot on my foot to be found. No breaking in required, and tons of support. Just really happy with these for $60.
customer_reviews.author: Stefanie

customer_reviews.title: Poorly made shoes
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for zumba classes and found them completely inefficient for it and falling apart too soon. The soles of the shoes would slide around on the basketball court flooring, making them impossible to wear for zumba class. I have since used them around the house for pedaling on my deskcycle and within 3 months of total use, the sole of the shoe is already falling off (please see picture).
customer_reviews.author: Marylander

customer_reviews.title: The most comfortable shoes I’ve ever owned
customer_reviews.text: I don’t usually buy shoes off the Internet, and I had never even heard of Ryka brand, but this was a great purchase! Not only do they look cool and fit perfectly, but they are so comfortable! I got them specifically for Zumba but I find myself wearing them around everywhere. These are great shoes, I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: architechie

customer_reviews.title: Fits well, could have better side movement support
customer_reviews.text: Overall a good pair of shoes. The support for side to side movement could be better. I bought these for cardio dance. I was having back issues so I decided to get a new pair of shoes. These were light and turning is easy. However, I bought a pair of Adidas because I need more side support. I will use these for less intense workout classes. They did help with the back pain. Just enough cushion without being heavy.
customer_reviews.author: AMWKindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Would be a good shoe for lifting
customer_reviews.text: The toe box area is roomy allowing your foot to be a good base for lifting, but I was looking for a cardio workout shoe for jumping and switching directions. The support around the ball of the foot was not good enough for that. If I was going to be doing squats and deadlifts, etc...I would have kept these shoes.
customer_reviews.author: momof three

customer_reviews.title: Not for flat or wide feet
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are stylish but they are not comfortable to me. I bought these shoes for aerobic exercise, dance fitness and cross training. The toebox needs a lot more cushion for the forefoot and there is a definite arch that seemed to go all the way into the heel and really bothered me when I stood up in the shoes. I have a wide foot and the heel just is not wide enough for me. It really bothered my heel. However, you can definitely turn easier in these shoes when dancing. I will be sticking to my Mizuno's. Nothing beats them in comfort and support.
customer_reviews.author: H. Rush

customer_reviews.title: Great fit and support. True to size.
customer_reviews.text: The plastic shipping package was torn and the box showed up in pretty bad shape, however the shoes were (thankfully) in good condition. They fit as I expected, true to size for narrow feet, and are very comfortable. They held up well for walking and their first core/cardio workout gym class. They were more comfortable for my plantar fasciitis than any other gym shoes I've purchased. Good arch & heel support. I feel more secure with my lateral movements than other mesh outer gym shoes. Would definitely recommend these shoes for women.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Crawley

customer_reviews.title: Order larger
customer_reviews.text: These are nice shoes but unfortunately I had to return them because I ordered 8.5 wide and they felt tight.. maybe if I try them again I would try a half size larger.
customer_reviews.author: LMO

customer_reviews.title: Great for Zumba
customer_reviews.text: Decided to purchase online since Amazon’s return process is so easy should I need to return or exchange. I’m happy to say that this shoe is perfect for Zumba! It’s lightweight, sturdy for those side steps and pivots. My normal shoe size is 6-1/2 but for sneakers and boots I order a 7 and this fits great. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Aress

customer_reviews.title: No support for dancing
customer_reviews.text: It had loose toe box which caused pain with walking and dancing. This was a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: ok

product_meta.title: Ryka Women's Influence Cross Training Shoe
product_meta.description: Keep up with the rest of the class in the ryka influence. This women's training sneaker features a synthetic and mesh upper for comfort and breathability. Flex-foil and direct-fuse layers provide plenty of support. The textile lining and cushioning precise-return insole help keep your feet nice and comfortable. A dual impact midsole provides cushioning in the heel and forefront. This ryka sneaker also has a traction outsole with a footprint design. Move to the beat of your own drum with the ryka influence.
feature_bullets: Shaft measures approximately low-top from arch
Traction outsole with footprint design and pivot points for ease of movement
Flex-foil and direct Fuse layers provide support
Dual density foam midsole with high impact N-Gage EVA energy return provides shape retention and cushioning on impact
